snippet: After strong criticism of Georgia’s response to a Jan. 28 storm that crippled Atlanta, Gov. Nathan Deal has declared a state of emergency before an ice storm coming on Tuesday. Meanwhile, outside of Philadelphia, thousands are still without power...
abstract: After strong criticism of Georgia’s response to a Jan. 28 storm that crippled Atlanta, Gov. Nathan Deal has declared a state of emergency before an ice storm coming on Tuesday. Meanwhile, outside of Philadelphia, thousands are still without power from last week’s ice storm.

headline.main: Georgia Governor Promises State Is Better Prepared for Coming Storm
